newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 30.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 30.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Cultus announced on Thursday its 25 percent-owned Cornea field off North-Western Australia had oil in place of up to 2.6 billion barrels of oil, which would make it one of Australia's largest ever oil discoveries. Joint venture partner Shell, however, hosed down the scale of the recovery, saying that a likely recovery rate was in the five to 35 percent range.

The Australian newspaper reported on Friday that Asahi Brewing, which holds 14 percent of Foster's, had quietly indicated it wanted to sell its stake. However the report did not include any attribution.

CSR Ltd said on Friday it has sold its American Aggregates quarrying business in Indiana and Ohio, and expects to sell the remaining Michigan business within a few days. CSR said the total purchase price of the two sales would be about A$345 million and it would book a A$4 million loss from the deal.
Australis is expected to release its nine month result later on Friday.
